attributes.action: make it illegal for banks to induce the financially naive into reaching unregulated agreements secured on their homes and that any legislation should be made retrospective
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My bank induced me into reaching an agreement consolidating two regulated products into (unbeknownst to me at the time) one unregulated product which was duly signed be me on 14th May 1992.  

In an internal bank document stated that it believed I was financially naive.  

My home is secured under that agreement which I now know to be unregulated, the appropriate regulatory authorities cannot investigate complaints arising out of unregulated agreements.

I do not believe it is right and proper for any financial institution to induce the financially naive into reaching unregulated agreements secured on their homes without first discussing those beliefs with the customer.  

Nor do I believe it is right and proper for any unregulated agreement to be secured on one's home whatever the circumstances, this could be a deprivation of one's rights under Article 8 of the Human Rights Act.
